channel.title: [CONTEST] Third Auxy Tournament! - Winner: Xiejra!
channel.description:
Just a heads up, the tournament has now already started so it's too late to join. However, I will be hosting a summer tournament in June/July. ___________________ Hey guys! DHO here. I'm arranging a third Auxy Tournament with the help of the champion @Andrew_Adams who will be co-hosting. ;P This will work very much like the first two, but if you aren't familiar here's the deal-
How it Works - So, as stated in the previous tournament: Players 1-4 are in the tournament. Player 1 ends up against Player 2, and 3 against 4. If Player 1 beats 2, and Player 4 beats 3, then the two winners (1 and 4) will compete.
In this instance, however, there are 32 players.
Judging - You will be judged out of ten points in the following categories:
Creativity - How unique is the song compared to other Auxy tracks? It's good to have a balance. Sure you can randomly place notes and make automation, and, although it may be different, it's not necessarily pleasing to listen to.
Composition - How good is the actual composition, when you take out all the automation etc.?
Accuracy: How much you stuck to the challenge's rules.
Execution: How well did you execute all the ideas you tried to pull off? How is the instrument choice? Mixing?
Challenges - Well, you'll just have to see. ;P You'll be tested on lots of things, so be ready to work hard! You will have a week to complete each challenge.
Prizes - The last two finalists will get a :unicorn: to display next to your username.
Always next time - If you don't have time to enter this time around, don't fret. There will be a summer tournament (Auxy Tournament Four) in June or July. Though don't let that discourage you from entering this time around. ___________
Visual tournament bracket: https://challonge.com/thethirdauxy
Good luck all! We'll start off with round one as soon as the tournament is full.

item.title: [CONTEST] Third Auxy Tournament! - Winner: Xiejra!
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
The End

Wow guys! Great work! @Foxlike, @Xiejra, I was impressed with both of your entries. But sadly, only one of you could be picked as the winner.

That person isâ€¦

Xiejra!

Congrats! You did so well through the tournament and your stuff never failed to impress me! Your jazz chords entry was probably my favorite Auxy song of all time. You scored a grand total of 371 points in the tournament. Great job!

But that doesnâ€™t mean you didnâ€™t impress me either, Foxlike. Ever since your first entry, I knew youâ€™d probably make it pretty far. You have a very professional sound. The only thing that held you back at times was repetition imo.

And not just the winners. Everybody in the tournament did awesome and I think you all owe yourselves a huge pat on the back! You earned it.

Also, huge thanks to @Andrew_Adams for being an awesome co-host! He brought great ideas to the tournament and was always on top of his judging.

What next?

In a week or so @Andrew_Adams and I will be back at it with the summer tournament! Until then, I wish you all the best of luck with your musical journeys and hope you make it far!

See ya!

Read full topic

item.description:
@DHO WHICH IS IN A FEW HOURS SO Iâ€™M DONE: https://soundcloud.com/xiejramusic/auxy-tournament-o-final
yeah its very bad. Being restricted to 3 instruments and a drum kit is very very hard. I usually use a lot of layers in my tracks.

So I explored 3 genres; moombahtoon, Glitch Hop or some 6/8 styled beat and drum and bass. Enjoy :,(

GG @Foxlike
